tit.cmt: 定訳の読みとは違いますが、原文が「きゅうごう」のため修正しています。ファイル内は「きゅうごう」で統一しています。

sen.j: 宮号（きゅうごう）とは、日本の皇族に与えられる称号。
sen.e: Miyago (reigning name) is a title given to an Imperial family in Japan.
Kyugo (reigning name) is a title given to an Imperial family in Japan.
sen.cmt: 「きゅうごう」に統一しました。
sen.e: Kyugo (reigning name) is a title given to an Imperial family in Japan.

sen.j: 日本の皇族男子が宮家を新設し、独立して生計を立てる際に天皇より与えられる称号。
sen.e: It is a title given by the Emperor when a son of an Imperial family establishes a Miyake, becomes independent, and starts making a living.
It is a title given by the Emperor when a son of an Imperial family establishes a Miyake (house of an imperial prince), becomes independent, and starts making his living.
sen.cmt: Miyakeの補足を定訳を参照して追記しました。「宮家」のカッコ内説明を、用語統一リストに合わせました。'make a living'を'make his living'にしました。
sen.e: It is a title given by the Emperor when a son of an Imperial family establishes a Miyake (house of an imperial prince), becomes independent, and starts making his living.

sen.j: 通常は皇族男子が婚姻し独立する際に天皇から賜るが、三笠宮家の次男である宜仁親王は独身のまま宮家を創設し、桂宮の称号を賜った。
sen.e: Normally it is given by the Emperor when a son of an Imperial family gets married and becomes independent, but Imperial Prince Yoshihito, the second son of the Mikasanomiya family established a Miyake unmarried and was given the title of Katsuranomiya.

Normally it is given by the Emperor when a son of an Imperial family gets married and becomes independent, but Imperial Prince Yoshihito, the second son of the Mikasanomiya family established a Miyake unmarried and was given the title of Katsuranomiya.

Normally it is given by the Emperor when a son of an Imperial family gets married and becomes independent, but Imperial Prince Yoshihito, the second son of the Mikasanomiya family established a Miyake unmarried and was given the title of Katsuranomiya.

sen.j: 三笠宮（寛仁親王は独立して生計を立てているが、宮家の継承者のため宮号はない）
sen.e: Mikasanomiya (Although Imperial Prince Tomohito became independent and is making a living, he has no Miyago because he is the successor of the Miyake.)
Mikasanomiya (Although Imperial Prince Tomohito became independent and is making his living, he has no Kyugo because he is the heir to the Mikasanomiya family).
sen.cmt: making a living -> making his livingsuccesseor of -> heir tothe Miyake -> the Mikasanomiya familyピリオドの位置をカッコの外に変更しました。
sen.e: Mikasanomiya (Although Imperial Prince Tomohito became independent and is making his living, he has no Kyugo because he is the heir to the Mikasanomiya family).
Hitachinomiya
Hitachinomiya
Hitachinomiya
Katsuranomiya
Katsuranomiya
Katsuranomiya

sen.j: 高円宮（高円宮憲仁親王の薨去により、憲仁親王妃久子が当主格とされている）
sen.e: Takamadonomiya (Because of the death of Imperial Prince Takamadonomiya Norihito, Princess Hisako, the wife of Imperial Prince Norihito is considered to be the present head of the family).
Takamadonomiya (because of the death of Imperial Prince Takamado no miya Norihito, Princess Hisako, the wife of Imperial Prince Norihito is considered to be the present head of the family).
Takamadonomiya (because of the death of Imperial Prince Takamado no miya Norihito, Princess Hisako, the wife of Imperial Prince Norihito is considered to be the present head of the family).
Akishinonomiya
Akishinonomiya
Akishinonomiya
